Pros: Just as pictured. My teens loved the modern style, the cool swing, the popcorn maker, and the amazing projector for streaming videos. A simple but well-kept place, clean, a short drive to anywhere you want to go in RVA. Eugene is friendly and welcoming. This was a great place for us to stay during a kid’s sports tournament, and I was able to work from the apartment between games.
Could improve: Hesitate to leave negatives because Eugene let me know the place is a new listing and he is still setting up. But other guests may want to know — kitchen stocking is very limited (no baking pan, dishwasher detergent). Not a big deal, just stepped out to grab but would have brought if I’d known. If you want to cook, bring what you’ll need. Also, trains at night are very loud. Also not a big deal (nothing wakes my teens), but I’d stay elsewhere or bring earplugs if you need a quiet place to sleep.
Overall, we recommend!

Our stay was only okay, however, due to a mismatch between our expectations and actual experience. We expected the “private apartment” to be a fully separate residence, but it felt more like a set of rooms closed off from the main house by an unlocked interior door. The space does not have its own temperature control and it was quite warm. We ran into Bill on our way out to dinner and he kindly asked how the temperature was and said he’d turn it down a little for us. We still felt warm overnight and had to open the door to the balcony to sleep comfortably. On the positive side, the location is great, the bed was comfortable (too firm for my husband, but comfortable for me), the blackout curtains were great, and the breakfast foods and Keurig were a nice touch. I think guests who know all this in advance, are comfortable staying in a space connected to a primary residence, and interacting with the owners would enjoy this place. We stayed at Jonathan’s place for two nights while visiting Richmond over Memorial Day weekend. Overall, it was fantastic - very clean, easy to access, extremely walkable to local shops/bars/restaurants, and really well appointed. The only thing wrong with our stay at Jonathan’s place was that we didn’t book it longer. There is a lot to do in and around Richmond, especially in the shockoe slip/bottom area so take that into account if you're planning a visit.
As for the interior, the loft space was beautiful and had the industrial feel of exposed wooden beams and concrete, but with excellent minimalist decor that added a touch of warmth. If you like that style, you will love this place. The pictures are very accurate. Appliances were new and in great shape, bathroom was very clean with great shower and tub. Washer and dryer in unit was a major plus. Roku enabled TVs worked well and were easy to cast to for music and video, and the wifi was strong throughout the unit. Bed was comfortable and the AC split units in the bed and living areas allowed for easy temperature control throughout the entire space. Definitely recommended for those that like to be close to amenities, restaurants, bars, etc.
Jonathan was a great host and was very communicative even though we didn't really need much assistance because it was all detailed out in the instructions.
Great place and great time - we would certainly stay at Jonathan's again.

Lots of Pros – Little things like Keurig coffee pods were supplied, double ply toilet paper (it’s the little things that matter!), nice comfortable firm bed. No lumps or indentions, best Airbnb bed I’ve had in a while. The bed is in the second story loft which is nice. Means no one is above you stomping at night so equals a quiet sleep. The white noise machine is a nice touch too. Even though you’re close to Main St you really can’t hear the traffic unless someone’s bass is blasting through the roof. Water pressure is a touch low (maybe pressure tank for water heater needs more air pressure?), but plenty of hot water. Loved having a washer and dryer too. Lots of local eats to walk to – we went to Carmelas, La Bodega, Tree’s Tacos, Sweet things to name a few Perfect location to attractions we wanted to go to – Maymont, James River, local breweries etc all close by within 10 minutes.
Some Tips:
The door on the back of the building to access parking is labeled Jsquared Interior Staging and Design. The other doors are labeled 1906 and 1904 so you never see a 1908 in the back. First time we went around to the front of the building, but of course the back is more convenient.
If you like total darkness when you sleep, the Led on ac can be turned off but still runs.

Communication before our stay was clear and entry was smooth. The house has been restored with care. Historic architectural details mingle with modern finishings like a renovated kitchen, brand new bathrooms and hardwood floors. The house is stylishly and minimally decorated, with no detail spared. It felt like a dream home!
The kitchen was fully stocked with anything you could need. The bathrooms had complimentary toiletries and cozy towels. Each bed was comfortable. It felt like home immediately.
We loved the front and back porches for morning coffee. There was also a private outdoor space for our kids to play.
Parking was easy, and the neighborhood is extremely walkable. Within minutes you can walk to so many different restaurants, shops, museums, playgrounds, and a Whole Foods.
Don't hesitate to book. We cannot wait to return!
